meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the presence of only one sex.
meanings.sent1: The plant species is unisexual, with each individual having either male or female reproductive organs.
meanings.sent2: In some animals, such as snails, unisexual individuals can reproduce without a mate.
meanings.sent3: The unisexual flowers seemed to gossip about their lack of need for a partner.
meanings.sent4: The unisexual nature of the species was like a solo performance in a grand orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The concept of unisexual organisms was as clear as a single color in a black-and-white picture.

meanings.definition: Having reproductive organs of only one sex.
meanings.sent1: The unisexual fish can change their sex depending on environmental conditions.
meanings.sent2: Certain plants are unisexual, producing either male or female flowers.
meanings.sent3: The unisexual insects threw a party to celebrate their unique reproductive system.
meanings.sent4: The unisexual nature of the species was a beacon of simplicity in a complex world.
meanings.sent5: The unisexual organisms stood out in the ecosystem like a single star in the night sky.
